title: Techy condensed typeface
content:
Hi sleuthers :)

I am looking for the typeface used for titles and copy on this poster.

Thanks in advance :)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820215226im_/http:/typophile.com/files/38_sonodetail7_6250.jpg)
author: mtsthelen

comments.content:
According to this [PDF](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820215226/http:/www.culture-besancon.fr/sites/default/files/SONORAMADossierDePresse.pdf), the font is called "sonorama", most probably a bespoke typeface exclusively done for this occasion (by [Helmo](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820215226/http:/www.helmo.fr/ongoing/sonorama)?), some sort of DIN Rounded (Mono).  
Similars: [Tesca](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820215226/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nmassi/tesca), [Base Mono](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820215226/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fenotype/eb-base-mono), [Bebel](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820215226/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmeister/fm-bebel), [Generika](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820215226/http:/www.milieugrotesque.com/typeface-generika), [Simple](http://web.archive.org/web/20130820215226/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Simple)

Ah, nice ! Really good detective work.

Thanks for the similars -- they will help tremendously :)
